intro: Cleistes grandiflora, commonly known as the sweet-pink orchid, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is characterized by its delicate, pinkish-white flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. The plant has a short, stocky stem with broad, ovate leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. It thrives in moist, shaded environments, typically in woodlands or along stream banks. Cleistes grandiflora is a rare and endangered species, making conservation efforts crucial for its survival.
